reviewText: I'm a big martial arts fan, so these old school movies were right up my alley.  All were enjoyable.

Blind Warrior (1987)

A psychopathic and brutal Indonesian despot terrorizes and exploits the rural population. The cruel warlord demands sacrifices from the villagers, slaughtering them when they don't meet his demands.

The Bravest Fist (1974)

After intimidating numerous towns and bulling the residents, Chan Wai Man goes on a fierce attack against the Martial thugs responsible.

The Challenger (1980)

The mysterious fighter Kam Ching Hung turns up at several martial arts schools and challenges leaders to duels, apparently with no discernible motive.

Five Kung Fu Daredevil Heroes (1977)

The heroes pose as gun dealers and acrobats in order to get close to the bad guys so they can avenge the death of one of their brothers. In the end, they lock the bad guys in a warehouse for a final battle to the death!

A Hero's Tears (1979)

Fu Sheng plays the son of a man who is destined to die at the hands of a man carrying a sword with a teardrop design forged into its blade. He believes that if he carries the sword then his father won't die.

Kingfisher the Killer (1981)

A violent nightclub owner wants his partner disposed of, in order to have complete control of the club. Willing to fight for power, the two engage in a series of action packed arguments.

The Mighty Four (1980)

Casanova is the son of a murdered warrior who has been groomed as a killing machine from birth and now is the time to unleash the beast!

Ninja Avenger (1982)

Authentic and unseen techniques are revealed for the first time as a Lady Ninja trained to seduce and kill her prey takes on a personal mission of revenge in the blood-spattered epic

The Rage of Wind (1973)

Japanese occupation of China breeds an ill wind which stirs the wrath of China's greatest Kung-Fu killers.

Ring of Death (1980)

A tale of an underdog mistreated by his family is given kung-fu instruction from an unlikely source and takes on foreign champions.

Triple Impact (1992)

This adventure takes you from the backstreets of America where brutal, full-contact blood-matches are staged by illegal gambling syndicates from the jungles of Asia.

Woman Avenger (1980)

An abused woman's journey from near-death to kung fu expert, helped along the way by a merciful Abbess and a crippled orphan.
I love these Kung Foo theatre style films!
if you are a fan of this genre there is plenty lo like here for the price

Lets start with the positives: No technical issues and audio muffling. The negatives are that most of the flicks, besides The Woman Avenger,The Bravest Fist, The Ninja Avenger(BEST ONE),and The Mighty Four,are passible and lackluster. They were OK,that's all. The worst was Five Kung-fu Daredevil Heroes that kept me dosing off. Worth a buy regardless even though this is my least favorite compilation. The few gem flicks were worth it.
A bit smaller than I expected but of good quality.
Most of the movies on this DVD had a bad ending.
